content:
If there is a Huddle message with me, B, and C, and B and C have a bit of a conversation while I'm away, I'll get missed message emails with two different subjects: "Missed Zulip from B" and "Missed Zulip from C". Each will have half the conversation.

Any ideas for how we could unify the subjects? Something like "Missed Zulip in conversation with B, C, D, and E" could potentially work, but is really long.
We could probably go for "Missed Zulip(s) in group private message conversation"
different conversations will thread together, but they may be fairly rare
I guess if we were worried about that, we could put a number, e.g. "Missed Zulip(s) in group private message conversation 451231", but I'm not sure that'll look good :)

Anyone know what other products do? Slack gives up ("Notifications from [team] for [time]"). Anyone know what facebook does?

Having the names is useful for me; I think I'd prefer "Missed Zulip in conversation with B, C, D, and E" to something more generic. I guess we could also make the sender "Zulip Missed Messages", and the subject "Group PM with B, C, D, and E".
Changing the sender name is a good idea
Maybe "Zulip Group PMs with B, C, D, and E)". And if it's more than 2-3 people, we just add "and 3 more people"

Opinions between the following?

Sender is: "Zulip Missed Messages" for both.

Option 1 for subject:

  • New mention from name in realm
  • New PM from name in realm
  • Group PMs with name_list in realm

Option 2 for subject:

  • name sent you a message in realm
  • name mentioned you in realm
  • Group PMs with name_list in realm
